0:
Leadership is a two-way street, loyalty up and loyalty down. Respect for one’s superiors; care for one’s crew 
 
- Grace Hopper
1: I have always been more interested in the future than in the past. - Grace Hopper
2: The glass is neither half empty nor half full. It’s simply larger than it needs to be. - Grace Hopper
3: The only phrase I’ve ever disliked is, 'Why, we’ve always done it that way.’ I always tell young people, ‘Go ahead and do it. You can always apologize later. - Grace Hopper
4: A ship in port is safe, but that is not what ships are built for. - Grace Hopper
5: In pioneer days they used oxen for heavy pulling, and when one ox couldn’t budge a log, they didn’t try to grow a larger ox. We shouldn’t be trying for bigger computers, but for more systems of computers. - Grace Hopper
6: We’ve tended to forget that no computer will ever ask a new question. - Grace Hopper
7: To me programming is more than an important practical art. It is also a gigantic undertaking in the foundations of knowledge. - Grace Hopper
